newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Gencor rises after QNI deal news.
newsitem.headline: Gencor rises after QNI deal news.

text.p: Shares in South African mining house Gencor Ltd rose on Wednesday after the firm announced the merger of its nickel operations with those of Australian nickel producer QNI Ltd.
Gencor shares were up 65 cents to 19.75 rand by 0737 GMT.

According to a QNI statement, opportunities from the merger include the expansion of Gencor's Cerro Matoso nickel mine in Colombia by the installation of a second furnace line to take production to about 50,000 tonnes per annum of nickel in ferronickel form over the remaining life of the mine.
In another development The Financial Times newspaper said on Wednesday Gencor is poised to announce a London listing for its aluminium, coal and metals businesses valued at around $7.0 billion.
The newspaper said that the group's precious metals operations would remain part of a separate business to be listed in Johannesburg.
The unsourced report said the demerger would mark the culmination of Gencor's transformation into an international metals group.
It said all Gencor's base metals businesses were likely to be grouped into the London-listed company.
